result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew X. Winters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew X. Winters is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew X. Winters was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $100 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Robert S, John W, or Ashley R or their residences, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

Extended Supervision Conditions-Ordered by the Court-
4 1/2 yrs WSP; 1 1/2 yrs Initial followed by 3 yrs ES.  Not eligible for CIP or SAP

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and victim is present in court.  Sentencing arguments made.      Defendant is sentenced to 4 1/2 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 yrs of Extended Supervision.  Sentence is concurrent with 14CM1563, 15CF160 and 15CF963.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Court costs are ordered.  No contact with Robert S., John W. Ashley R. or their residence unless permitted by either the court or agent.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation of supervision, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (late) with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions. 2:20 p.m. - Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (late) with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Prior orders vacated and bond reinstated.  Def. to meet with Atty Bielski to go over the presentence investigation.  Sentencing reset for 2/3/16 at 2:00.  Bond continued.

Count 2 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 1/14/16 at 1:30.  Bond continued.
